title: How do professional musicians cope with performance anxiety? - Quora

response.answer_text: They take Propranolol. Also known as the ‘performers drug’, it has been in use since the 1979s by Broadway performers, symphony and session musicians, singers, actors and everyone with anxiety. It was controversial among the musicians in the 70s. They thought it gave some folks an edge in the competive sport we call professiona music.

Some musicians thrive on this thrilling experience. The feeling compelling them to become the very thing they are doing. They become the guitar player on stage in a form of alter personality, as we all do when we serve the different roles in our daily lives. If it is a fear of performing then it is a lack of faith in themselves. There is nly those two things: fear and faith.
